availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Holt (Affiant in Powell Circuit Court case in 1863)

body.p: Mount Sterling, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Bath County, Kentucky native. Son of Mathis Holt and Francis Taylor Holt. Attended Twinsburg Institute in Ohio. Attended Fort Edward Institute in New York. Graduated from Albany Law Institute in 1862. Attorney in Mount Sterling from 1863 to 1884. Married to Sarah Ann Roberts Holt on October 19, 1864. Elected Judge of Kentucky Court of Appeals in 1884. Appointed Judge of U.S. District Court of Puerto Rico in 1900.

ab.bibl: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mt. Sterling, p. 3. First Annual Register of Porto Rico, Office of the Secretary, 1901, p. 67-68. New Jersey Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1670-1965), KDLA, Roll #001903025, Trenton Marriages, p. unknown. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016218, All Counties Death Certificates, p. 14.
